trans-unit.source:
\n

Adds a buffering layer to read and write operations on another stream.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx x xxxxxxxxx xxxxx xx xxxx xxx xxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets a value indicating whether the current stream supports reading.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx x xxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source: true if the stream supports reading; false if the stream is closed or was opened with write-only access.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxx$ $xxxxxx$xxxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxx$xxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets a value indicating whether the current stream supports seeking.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx x xxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source: true if the stream supports seeking; false if the stream is closed or if the stream was constructed from an operating system handle such as a pipe or output to the console.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxx$ $xxxxxx$xxxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxx xx xx xxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xxxx xx x xxxx xx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets a value indicating whether the current stream supports writing.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx x xxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source: true if the stream supports writing; false if the stream is closed or was opened with read-only access.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxx$ $xxxxxx$xxxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxx xxxx$xxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Methods were called after the stream was closed.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the position within the current stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

An I/O error occurs, such as the stream being closed.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xx X$X xxxxx xxxxxx$ xxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Methods were called after the stream was closed.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Clears all buffers for this stream and causes any buffered data to be written to the underlying device.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxx xx xx xxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The data source or repository is not open.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Asynchronously clears all buffers for this stream, causes any buffered data to be written to the underlying device, and monitors cancellation requests.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxx$ xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxx xx xx xxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx$ xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The token to monitor for cancellation requests.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxx xx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A task that represents the asynchronous flush operation.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxx xxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Copies bytes from the current buffered stream to an array.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxx xxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The buffer to which bytes are to be copied.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxx xxx xx xx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The byte offset in the buffer at which to begin reading bytes.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The number of bytes to be read.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xx xx xxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The total number of bytes read into array.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxx xxxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$.

trans-unit.source:
This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or 0 if the end of the stream has been reached before any data can be read.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxxx xxx xx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxxx xxxx xxxxx xxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx$ xx 0 xx xxx xxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxx xxx xx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The stream is not open or is null.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxx xx xx $xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Methods were called after the stream was closed.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Asynchronously reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream, advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read, and monitors cancellation requests.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxx x xxxxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx$ xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxx$ xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The buffer to write the data into.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxx xxxx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The byte offset in buffer at which to begin writing data from the stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xxxxxx xx $xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The maximum number of bytes to read.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The token to monitor for cancellation requests.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxx xx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A task that represents the asynchronous read operation.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source: The value of the TResult parameter contains the total number of bytes read into the buffer.
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxxxx xx xxx $xx$XXxxxxx$$xx$ xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source: The result value can be less than the number of bytes requested if the number of bytes currently available is less than the requested number, or it can be 0 (zero) if the end of the stream has been reached.
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxxxxx xxxxx xxx xx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx$ xx xx xxx xx 0 $xxxx$ xx xxx xxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The sum of offset and count is larger than the buffer length.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxx xx $xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The stream is currently in use by a previous read operation.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xx x xxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Reads a byte from the underlying stream and returns the byte cast to an int, or returns -1 if reading from the end of the stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxx x xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxx xxxx xx xx $xxxxxx$xxx$$xxxxxx$$ xx xxxxxxx $0 xx xxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxx xx xxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The byte cast to an int, or -1 if reading from the end of the stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xxxx xx xx $xxxxxx$xxx$$xxxxxx$$ xx $0 xx xxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxx xx xxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

An I/O error occurs, such as the stream being closed.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xx X$X xxxxx xxxxxx$ xxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Methods were called after the stream was closed.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Sets the position within the current buffered stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The new position within the current buffered stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The stream is not open or is null.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxx xx xx $xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Methods were called after the stream was closed.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Sets the length of the buffered stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

An integer indicating the desired length of the current buffered stream in bytes.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The stream is not open or is null.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxx xx xx $xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The stream does not support both writing and seeking.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Methods were called after the stream was closed.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Copies bytes to the buffered stream and advances the current position within the buffered stream by the number of bytes written.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The byte array from which to copy count bytes to the current buffered stream.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xxxxx xxxx xxxxx xx xxxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The offset in the buffer at which to begin copying bytes to the current buffered stream.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The number of bytes to be written to the current buffered stream.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xx xx xxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Methods were called after the stream was closed.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Asynchronously writes a sequence of bytes to the current stream, advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written, and monitors cancellation requests.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx x xxxxxxxx xx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx$ xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxx$ xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The zero-based byte offset in buffer from which to begin copying bytes to the stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx$xxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xx $xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xxxx xxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The maximum number of bytes to write.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The token to monitor for cancellation requests.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxx xx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A task that represents the asynchronous write operation.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxx xxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The sum of offset and count is larger than the buffer length.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxx xx $xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The stream is currently in use by a previous write operation.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xx x xxxxxxxx xxxxx xxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Writes a byte to the current position in the buffered stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxx x xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A byte to write to the stream.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxx xx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Methods were called after the stream was closed.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxx.
